subtitleNullable: Data containing fields about Social Media impact on unhealthy comparison.
descriptionNullable:
Dataset Description
Overview

The dataset titled "Social Media Usage and Insecurities in Southeast Asia" was developed in collaboration with a leading social media analytics firm. It comprises 200,000 entries, reflecting data collected from a diverse and representative sample of users across several Southeast Asian countries, including the Philippines, Indonesia, Vietnam, and Malaysia.
Objective

This dataset is part of a broader research initiative aimed at understanding the societal impacts of social media usage, particularly focusing on mental health indicators such as self-esteem, depression, and anxiety, as well as behavioral patterns like social connectivity and online community engagement.

Data were collected in compliance with local laws and international standards for data privacy and user consent. The anonymized and aggregated data ensures user confidentiality while providing valuable insights into the social media landscape of the region.

This dataset serves as a comprehensive resource for researchers, policymakers, and social media companies aiming to create safer and more supportive online environments.
